sentences: Jeremy Steig (September 23, 1942 – April 13, 2016) was an American jazz flutist.
Steig was born in Manhattan, the son of New Yorker cartoonist William Steig and Elizabeth (Mead) Steig, head of the fine arts department at Lesley College.
His song "Howlin' For Judy", from his 1970 album Legwork, was sampled in the Beastie Boys' 1994 single "Sure Shot", providing the main instrumental part of the song.
He lived in Japan with his wife Asako.
He died in Yokohama from cancer on April 13, 2016.
Four years after his death, Byroad Press published his memoir, Get Me Out of Here, fulfilling his final wish.
Temple of Birth (Columbia) with Richard Beirach and Johnny Winter
Leaving (Trio [Japan] Records; reissued on Storyville in 1988) with Richard Beirach
1978: Lend Me Your Ears (Creative Music Productions/CMP) with Eddie Gómez and Joe Chambers
Journey Thru an Electric Tube (Solid State, 1968)With Idris Muhammad
Boogie To The Top (Kudu/CTI, 1978)With Lalo Schifrin
